author: jason.carver
content: Before we get too far down this path, this needs a painful rebase (for example, both Pawan and Nick independently created different `clap` configs). I'll get started on it...

author: protolambda
content: About talk-req/resp usage: can we chat about it some time? Eventually I'd like to use this same discv5 extension functionality to implement data-availability-sampling for eth2. No need for uTP I think, as samples are rather small and fit in individual packets, but I'm curious about your experience with this talk-req/resp thing in discv5 so far. I don't believe the Go implementation has this same functionality yet, so I may start implementing that (in a few weeks from now).

author: jason.carver
content: Ah, nevermind, wasn't too bad because Pawan removed the main conflicts in later commits, so squashing before rebasing cleared it up. <@!689161464829050960> should be as easy as something like https://github.com/carver/trin/commits/discv5-quilt-rebase (that's based on a CLI cleanup that hasn't hit master yet)

author: jason.carver
content: Yeah, would be happy to. I haven't used it enough to have opinions on the ergonomics of the API yet, but I'm sure I will soon. ðŸ™‚
